title: UTOPIA Index File 2
historical_context: This article provides a comprehensive list of BITNET member institutions, reflecting the early days of academic networking and the growth of computer communications in the late 1980s.
target_audience: Researchers, educators, and anyone interested in the history of academic networking and computer communications.
short_summary: The article lists various member institutions of the BITNET network, organized by state. It serves as a historical reference for understanding the landscape of academic computing during the late 1980s.
summary:
The UTOPIA Index File 2 is a detailed enumeration of institutions that were part of the BITNET network as of December 1988. BITNET, which stands for Because It's Time Network, was one of the earliest networks connecting academic institutions, allowing for the sharing of resources and communication among universities. The article categorizes institutions by state, providing a snapshot of the academic landscape at the time, including universities, research centers, and colleges across the United States. This index not only serves as a historical document but also highlights the collaborative spirit of the academic community in the era of burgeoning computer networks.

The significance of this article lies in its role as a reference for researchers and historians interested in the evolution of networked communication in academia. It illustrates how institutions began to connect and share information, paving the way for the modern internet. The UTOPIA Index File 2 is a testament to the foundational work done in the late 20th century that has shaped the way educational institutions interact and share knowledge today.
